senses.sense_definition: A person who reminds someone of something.

examples.text: He acted as a faithful <w>remembrancer</w>, ensuring the king did not forget his promises.
I need no <w>remembrancer</w> to tell me what my duties are in this house.

senses.sense_definition: An object kept as a reminder or souvenir of a person or event.

examples.text: She kept the small locket as a sad <w>remembrancer</w> of her lost love.
This stone serves as a <w>remembrancer</w> of our long journey to the coast.

senses.sense_definition: An official of the City of London Corporation who represents its interests in Parliament and at the Royal Court.

examples.text: The City <w>Remembrancer</w> attended the meeting to discuss the new legislation affecting the financial district.
Historically, the <w>Remembrancer</w> acts as a channel of communication between the City and the Crown.

senses.sense_definition: A former official in the Court of Exchequer responsible for collecting debts owed to the Crown.

examples.text: The King's <w>Remembrancer</w> was a high-ranking officer in the medieval exchequer.
Old documents describe the specific duties of the <w>remembrancer</w> regarding debt collection.
